description: A comprehensive 14-day ketogenic meal plan targeting approximately 75% fat, 20% protein, and 5% carbohydrates at a 2000-calorie base. Built around whole-food fat sources: avocados, olive oil, butter, nuts, fatty fish, and cheese. All scalable ingredients use precise gram measurements for proportional calorie adjustment. Based on evidence from systematic reviews (Bueno et al., 2013; Paoli et al., 2023) and current ketogenic nutrition guidelines.
scaling_notes: Scale all 'scalable: true' ingredients proportionally. For 2500cal, multiply by 1.25. Primary scaling levers: fat sources (olive oil, butter, nuts, avocado). Fixed items (spices, garnishes) stay constant.

ingredients.notes: About 3 eggs, room temperature for best texture
About 2-3 strips, high quality for best flavor
Fine sea salt, add at very end

instructions: Remove eggs from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Heat large skillet over medium heat and cook bacon strips until golden and crispy, about 4-5 minutes per side
Transfer bacon to paper towels to drain, then chop into small pieces when cool
Wilt fresh spinach in the bacon fat for 1-2 minutes until just tender, then set aside
Crack room temperature eggs into heavy-bottomed saucepan (not non-stick)
Add cold butter pieces directly to raw eggs in saucepan - do not whisk yet
Place saucepan over medium heat and begin stirring immediately with rubber spatula
Stir constantly and vigorously, scraping bottom and sides, as eggs and butter warm together
Continue cooking and stirring for 90 seconds, then remove pan from heat
Keep stirring off heat for 20 seconds as residual heat continues cooking
Return to heat and continue stirring for another 90 seconds until eggs start to thicken
Repeat on-off heat process 2-3 times until eggs are creamy but still slightly loose (total 4-5 minutes)
When eggs are almost done, remove from heat and immediately add cold crème fraîche
Stir in crème fraîche to stop cooking process and create silky texture
Gently fold in wilted spinach and chopped bacon
Add freshly grated cheddar cheese while eggs are still warm to melt slightly
Season with fine salt and white pepper to taste (season at end to prevent toughening)
Serve immediately on warm plates, garnished with fresh chives
Eggs should be creamy, silky, and just set - never dry or rubbery

ingredients.notes: Store-bought or homemade sugar-free Caesar dressing

equipment_needed: Gas or charcoal grill (or grill pan as alternative)
Meat mallet or rolling pin (if needed for even thickness)
instructions: Remove chicken from refrigerator 20-30 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature (ensures even cooking)
If chicken breasts vary in thickness, place in freezer bag and gently pound to uniform ¾-inch thickness
Pat chicken completely dry with paper towels (moisture prevents good searing)
Brush chicken with all 10ml olive oil on both sides, coating evenly
Season generously with salt and pepper on both sides, pressing gently to help seasoning adhere
Preheat grill to medium-high heat (425-450°F / 220-230°C). Clean grates and oil them to prevent sticking
Place chicken on hottest part of grill over direct heat. Grill 4-5 minutes without moving (creates sear marks)
Flip chicken once and grill another 4-5 minutes on second side
Insert thermometer into thickest part of chicken - remove when internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C)
Transfer chicken to cutting board and tent with foil. Rest 5-8 minutes (temperature will rise to safe 165°F/74°C)
While chicken rests, wash romaine lettuce thoroughly and chop into bite-sized pieces, discarding thick white stems
Place chopped romaine in large serving bowl and toss with Caesar dressing until evenly coated
Slice rested chicken against the grain into ½-inch thick strips (this ensures tenderness)
Arrange sliced chicken over the dressed romaine lettuce
Use microplane or fine grater to grate fresh parmesan directly over salad
Serve immediately while chicken is still warm for best flavor and texture

ingredients.notes: Avocado oil or refined olive oil

equipment_needed: Heavy-bottomed stainless steel or cast iron pan
instructions: Remove salmon from refrigerator 15 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Pat salmon completely dry with paper towels until skin feels dry (this ensures good searing)
Season salmon generously with salt and pepper on both sides
Cut broccoli into uniform 1-1.5 inch florets for even cooking
Bring 1 inch of water to boil in saucepan, place steamer basket inside, reduce to medium heat
Heat heavy-bottomed pan over medium-high heat until very hot (425-450°F / 220-230°C)
Add oil to hot pan - it should shimmer but not smoke
Place salmon skin-side up in pan, press gently for 10 seconds to ensure contact
Sear salmon undisturbed for 4-5 minutes until golden brown crust forms
While salmon cooks, add broccoli to steamer, cover and steam for 5 minutes
Flip salmon carefully using thin spatula, cook skin-side down for 2-3 minutes more
Check internal temperature - remove at 125-135°F (52-57°C) for medium-rare to medium
Remove salmon to plate, tent with foil and let rest 3 minutes (temperature will rise slightly)
Test broccoli with fork - should be tender-crisp and bright green
Melt butter in small saucepan, toss steamed broccoli with melted butter and season with salt
Serve salmon immediately with buttered broccoli alongside
Remove cream cheese from refrigerator 15 minutes before serving to soften
Cut avocado in half, remove pit, and slice into ¼-inch thick wedges
Immediately brush avocado slices with fresh lemon juice to prevent browning
Arrange avocado slices in an overlapping fan pattern on one side of serving plate
Tear smoked salmon into elegant ribbons rather than laying flat (creates better texture)
Artfully arrange salmon ribbons alongside avocado, allowing natural curves and folds
Using small spoon, place 3-4 dollops of cream cheese around the plate for visual balance
Drizzle extra virgin olive oil lightly over avocado and salmon
Season with freshly cracked black pepper and optional flaky sea salt
Garnish with fresh dill sprigs if desired for color and aroma
Serve immediately on chilled plates for best presentation and freshness

ingredients.notes: Or Greek yogurt for lighter option

instructions: Drain tuna and place in mixing bowl, breaking apart with fork into smaller chunks
Finely dice celery into small uniform pieces for consistent texture
If using red onion, dice very finely and rinse briefly under cold water to reduce sharpness
Add mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, half the lemon juice, salt, and pepper to tuna
Mix ingredients thoroughly with fork, maintaining some tuna texture (don't over-mash)
Cut avocados in half lengthwise and carefully remove pits without damaging flesh
Using small spoon, carefully scoop out small amount of avocado flesh to create larger cavity
Immediately brush exposed avocado flesh with remaining lemon juice to prevent browning
If needed, trim small slice from bottom of avocado halves so they sit upright on plate
Season avocado cavities lightly with salt and pepper
Generously fill each avocado half with tuna mixture, mounding slightly above rim
Garnish with fresh chopped dill or parsley for color and flavor
Serve immediately at room temperature for best flavor, or chill briefly if preferred

equipment_needed: Large oven-safe skillet or cast iron pan
instructions: Remove chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Pat chicken thighs completely dry with paper towels and season generously with salt and pepper
Heat large skillet over medium-high heat until very hot
Add butter and let it melt and begin to foam
Place chicken thighs skin-side down, press gently, and sear undisturbed for 4-5 minutes until golden crust forms
Flip chicken using tongs and sear another 3-4 minutes on the other side
Check internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C) - if not, cook 2-3 minutes more
Remove chicken to plate, tent with foil to keep warm
Reduce heat to medium, keep about 1 tablespoon of fat in pan for sauce base
Add minced garlic to pan and sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant (don't let it burn)
Add heavy cream to pan, scraping up any browned bits from bottom with wooden spoon
Bring cream to gentle simmer, then gradually whisk in grated parmesan cheese
Continue whisking until sauce is smooth and starts to thicken (2-3 minutes)
Add fresh spinach to pan and stir gently until wilted and incorporated into sauce
Return chicken thighs to pan, spooning sauce over top to coat
Simmer 2-3 minutes more to let flavors meld and sauce thicken further
Serve immediately with extra sauce spooned over chicken

ingredients.notes: Grated or torn into small pieces

equipment_needed: Two bowls (one for eggs, one for beaten eggs)
instructions: Remove eggs from refrigerator 15 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Clean mushrooms with damp paper towel and slice into thin, uniform pieces
Heat half the butter (9g) in omelette pan over medium heat
Add sliced mushrooms to pan and sauté for 3-4 minutes until golden and liquid evaporates
Season mushrooms lightly with salt and pepper, then transfer to plate and set aside
Crack eggs into bowl, checking each one before adding to avoid broken yolks
Whisk eggs vigorously in circular motion until whites and yolks are completely combined and mixture is pale
Heat remaining butter in the same pan over medium heat until it starts to foam
Pour beaten eggs into center of pan, letting them spread naturally
Immediately begin gentle circular stirring motion with spatula while shaking pan in circular motion
Continue for 15-20 seconds until eggs are mostly set but still slightly wet on top
Stop stirring and let omelette set for 30 seconds
Add sautéed mushrooms to one half of omelette, then sprinkle mozzarella over mushrooms
Using spatula, carefully fold empty half of omelette over the filled half
Let cheese melt for 30-60 seconds, then slide omelette onto serving plate
Garnish with fresh herbs if desired and serve immediately while cheese is still warm and melty

ingredients.notes: Choose good quality 80/20 blend for flavor

equipment_needed: Large stainless steel or cast iron skillet
instructions: Line a plate with paper towels for draining bacon
Cut bacon into ½-inch pieces for easier cooking and eating
Heat large skillet over medium heat (cold start prevents sticking)
Add bacon pieces to cold pan and cook 6-8 minutes, stirring occasionally until golden and crispy
Remove bacon to paper towel-lined plate, leaving 1 tablespoon fat in pan for beef
Increase heat to medium-high and let pan get hot
Add ground beef to hot pan in single layer, break into chunks by hand
Let beef brown undisturbed for 4-5 minutes to develop good crust
Break up meat with wooden spoon and continue cooking 3-4 minutes until fully browned
Season with salt and pepper during last minute of cooking
Drain excess fat using paper towel method (tilt pan, absorb with towels)
While beef rests, wash and chop romaine into bite-sized pieces
Cut avocado into cubes and season lightly with salt
Place romaine in large serving bowl as base layer
Top with hot seasoned ground beef in center
Arrange crispy bacon pieces around the beef
Add avocado cubes and finish with freshly grated cheddar
Serve immediately while beef is still warm and cheese begins to melt slightly

ingredients.notes: 1-1.5 inch thick, about 2 chops, room temperature before cooking
Young, tender beans with ends trimmed

instructions: Remove lamb chops from refrigerator 20-30 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Trim any excess fat from lamb chops, leaving thin layer for flavor (about 1/8 inch)
In small bowl, combine olive oil, minced garlic, chopped rosemary, thyme leaves, and half the lemon juice
Pat lamb chops completely dry with paper towels and season generously on both sides with kosher salt and black pepper
Rub herb and oil mixture all over lamb chops, massaging into meat - let marinate 10-15 minutes
Meanwhile, trim stem ends from green beans and rinse under cold water
Preheat grill to medium-high heat (450°F / 230°C) and clean grates with grill brush
Oil grill grates just before cooking to prevent sticking
Place marinated lamb chops on hottest part of grill and cook 3-4 minutes without moving them
Flip chops using tongs (never pierce with fork to avoid losing juices) and cook another 3-4 minutes
Check internal temperature with instant-read thermometer - 130°F (54°C) for medium-rare, 145°F (63°C) for medium
Remove lamb to cutting board and tent loosely with foil to rest 5 minutes (temperature will rise 5-10 degrees)
While lamb rests, heat skillet over medium-high heat and add green beans with 2 tablespoons water
Cover and steam green beans 3-4 minutes until bright green and tender-crisp
Remove lid, add butter and remaining lemon juice, toss to coat and season with salt and pepper
Arrange green beans on serving plate, slice lamb chops if desired, and serve immediately while both are hot
Final internal temperature should read 125-130°F (52-54°C) for perfect medium-rare doneness

ingredients.notes: Must be full-fat for proper thickness and creaminess
About 3 tablespoons, check freshness for proper absorption

instructions: Shake or stir canned coconut milk before using to combine separated cream and liquid
In wide-mouth jar or bowl, whisk together coconut milk, vanilla extract, pinch of sea salt, and sweetener if using
Add chia seeds gradually while whisking continuously to prevent clumping
Whisk vigorously for 2-3 minutes until chia seeds are evenly distributed throughout liquid
Let mixture sit at room temperature for 15-20 minutes, then whisk again to break up any forming clumps
Cover container and refrigerate for minimum 3 hours, preferably 8-12 hours (overnight) for best texture
After 2 hours in fridge, stir mixture once more to prevent settling and ensure even gel formation
While pudding sets, roughly chop pecans into bite-sized pieces
Optional: toast pecans in dry skillet over medium heat for 2-3 minutes until fragrant for enhanced flavor
If using butter for pecans, melt in skillet and toss toasted pecans to coat lightly
Check pudding texture after overnight rest - should be thick and gel-like, similar to tapioca pudding
If too thin, add 1 tablespoon more chia seeds and refrigerate 2 more hours
Serve pudding chilled, topped with cold heavy cream drizzled over surface
Finish with toasted pecans and additional pinch of sea salt if desired
Pudding keeps refrigerated for up to 5 days and actually improves in texture over time

ingredients.notes: 5-6 oz portion, 1 inch thick, skin-on for crispy texture
High smoke point oil for proper searing
1 clove, thinly sliced for butter sauce

equipment_needed: Heavy-bottomed stainless steel or cast iron skillet
instructions: Remove salmon from refrigerator 15 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Pat salmon fillet completely dry with paper towels, ensuring skin is moisture-free for proper crisping
Season flesh side generously with salt and pepper (avoid seasoning skin to prevent burning)
Trim woody ends from asparagus spears by snapping naturally at tender point
Heat heavy skillet over medium-high heat until very hot (oil should shimmer immediately when added)
Add avocado oil to hot pan and swirl to coat evenly
Place salmon skin-side down in pan, pressing gently with spatula for 10-15 seconds to keep skin flat
Cook undisturbed for 4-5 minutes until skin is golden brown and crispy (resist urge to move)
Carefully flip salmon using fish spatula and cook flesh side 2-3 minutes more
Check internal temperature reaches 125°F (52°C) for medium-rare or 130°F (54°C) for medium
Remove salmon to plate and tent with foil to rest while finishing asparagus
In same pan, add asparagus spears and cook 3-4 minutes, turning occasionally until bright green and tender-crisp
Push asparagus to one side of pan and reduce heat to medium-low
Add butter, sliced garlic, and thyme (if using) to clear side of pan
Swirl butter as it melts and becomes fragrant with garlic (about 1 minute)
Add lemon juice to butter mixture and swirl to combine into simple pan sauce
Toss asparagus in lemon butter and season with salt and pepper
Arrange asparagus on serving plate, place salmon on top, and drizzle with remaining lemon butter sauce
Serve immediately while salmon skin is still crispy and asparagus is tender-crisp

ingredients.notes: Sliced against the grain into thin strips
High smoke point oil for stir-frying
Pure sesame oil for finishing flavor

instructions: Slice sirloin against the grain into thin strips about ¼ inch thick (easier when meat is slightly frozen)
In mixing bowl, massage beef strips with baking soda and water until evenly distributed
Let beef sit 15 minutes to tenderize, then add cornstarch and 1 tablespoon coconut oil
Mix until beef is evenly coated with cornstarch mixture (velveting technique)
Add soy sauce to beef and marinate additional 15 minutes for flavor development
Meanwhile, bring large pot of salted water to rolling boil
Blanch broccoli florets in boiling water for exactly 10 seconds until bright green
Immediately remove broccoli with slotted spoon and rinse with cold water to stop cooking
Heat wok or large skillet over highest heat until smoking (essential for wok hei)
Add remaining coconut oil to hot wok and swirl to coat
Add marinated beef in single layer, let sear undisturbed 1 minute to develop crust
Stir-fry beef rapidly for 1-2 more minutes until 80% cooked (don't overcook)
Push beef to one side of wok and add minced garlic and ginger to clear space
Stir aromatics for 15 seconds until fragrant, then mix with beef
Add blanched broccoli to wok and toss everything together for 1 minute
Remove wok from heat and drizzle sesame oil around edges, tossing to combine
Season with additional salt if needed and serve immediately while hot
The beef should be tender and velvety, broccoli bright green and crisp-tender

ingredients.notes: About ¼ pound, removed from casing if in links

equipment_needed: Non-stick cooking spray or pastry brush
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) for optimal egg texture and even cooking
Generously grease 6 cups of muffin tin with olive oil using pastry brush, coating bottom and sides completely
Heat small skillet over medium heat and cook ground sausage, breaking into small crumbles
Cook sausage 4-5 minutes until browned and cooked through, then drain on paper towels
Let sausage cool slightly while preparing other ingredients to prevent eggs from cooking prematurely
Finely dice red bell pepper into small, uniform pieces (about ¼ inch) for even distribution
In mixing bowl, crack eggs and whisk until whites and yolks are completely combined
Season beaten eggs with salt and pepper to taste
Divide cooked sausage evenly among the 6 greased muffin cups, pressing gently into bottom
Sprinkle diced bell pepper over sausage in each cup for color and crunch
Carefully pour beaten egg mixture over sausage and peppers, filling each cup about ¾ full
Top each cup with freshly grated cheddar cheese, distributing evenly
Bake for 15-18 minutes until edges are golden brown and centers are just set (not jiggly)
Internal temperature should reach 160°F (71°C) for food safety
Remove from oven and let cool in pan for 2-3 minutes to firm up before removing
Run a knife around edges if needed to loosen, then gently remove cups
Garnish with chopped fresh chives if desired and serve immediately while hot and fluffy

ingredients.notes: Skin removed, cut into bite-sized pieces
Sliced into half-moons, ¼ inch thick

instructions: Place chicken thighs in freezer for 15 minutes to firm up for easier uniform slicing
Remove chicken and pat completely dry with paper towels
Cut chicken against the grain into bite-sized strips, about ¼ to ½ inch wide
In mixing bowl, combine chicken with half the soy sauce, cornstarch, and pinch of salt
Massage marinade into chicken and let sit 15-20 minutes for flavor development
Cut broccoli into uniform small florets and zucchini into ¼-inch half-moon slices
Heat wok or large skillet over highest heat until it begins to smoke lightly
Add coconut oil and swirl to coat the hot surface
Add marinated chicken in single layer, letting pieces sear undisturbed for 20 seconds
Stir-fry chicken rapidly for 2-3 minutes until pieces are golden and just cooked through (80%)
Remove chicken to plate and keep warm, leaving any oil in pan
Add broccoli to the same hot pan and stir-fry 2-3 minutes until bright green
Add zucchini slices and stir-fry additional 1-2 minutes until tender-crisp
Push vegetables to one side of pan and add minced garlic and ginger to clear space
Stir aromatics for 15 seconds until fragrant, then mix with vegetables
Return chicken to pan and toss everything together for 30 seconds to combine
Add remaining soy sauce and sesame oil, tossing quickly to coat
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately while hot
Vegetables should retain bright color and slight crunch, chicken should be tender and juicy

ingredients.notes: 6-7 oz portion, thick and even throughout, skin removed
Cut into uniform florets for even cooking
Divided: 10g for cod, 10g for cheese sauce
1 tablespoon juice, brightens both fish and vegetables
½ teaspoon leaves, or dried herbs
Preferred for white fish and cheese sauces

instructions: Remove cod from refrigerator 15 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) for optimal cod cooking temperature
Pat cod fillet completely dry with paper towels to prevent mushiness and ensure good browning
Season cod generously on both sides with salt, white pepper, and paprika
Rub 10g melted butter and half the lemon juice over cod, coating both sides
Place seasoned cod in baking dish and let rest while preparing cauliflower
Bring large pot of salted water to boil for cauliflower
Cut cauliflower into uniform florets (about 1-inch pieces) for even cooking
Boil cauliflower 8-10 minutes until fork-tender but not mushy
Drain cauliflower thoroughly in colander and let excess water evaporate 2 minutes
While cauliflower drains, bake cod 10-12 minutes until internal temperature reaches 140°F (60°C)
Meanwhile, in small saucepan over medium-low heat, melt remaining 10g butter
Add minced garlic to melted butter and sauté 30 seconds until fragrant
Slowly whisk heavy cream into garlic butter, bringing to gentle simmer
Remove cream sauce from heat and gradually add grated cheddar, whisking until smooth
Season cheese sauce with remaining lemon juice, thyme, salt, and white pepper
Place drained cauliflower in serving dish and pour hot cheese sauce over top
Remove cod when it flakes easily and internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C)
Let cod rest 2-3 minutes tented with foil, then serve alongside cheesy cauliflower
Garnish with fresh thyme and a final squeeze of lemon if desired

ingredients.notes: About 2.5 eggs, room temperature for better mixing
For bulletproof coffee and muffin greasing
MCT oil preferred for bulletproof coffee
Tender leaves, will wilt during cooking

instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) for optimal egg texture without over-browning
Generously grease 6 muffin cups with butter or cooking spray, coating bottom and sides completely
Heat small skillet over medium heat and briefly sauté fresh spinach until just wilted (1-2 minutes)
Remove spinach from heat and let cool slightly, then roughly chop to break up larger pieces
In large mixing bowl, crack eggs and whisk until whites and yolks are completely combined
Add heavy cream to eggs and whisk until smooth and well incorporated
Season egg mixture with salt, pepper, and garlic powder if using
Fold cooled chopped spinach into egg mixture, distributing evenly throughout
Divide spinach-egg mixture evenly among greased muffin cups, filling each about ¾ full
Bake for 15-18 minutes until edges are golden brown and centers are just set (not jiggly)
Meanwhile, brew strong coffee using 240ml hot water and freshly ground coffee beans
Test muffins with toothpick - should come out clean when fully cooked
Remove muffins from oven and let cool in pan 5 minutes to firm up before removing
While muffins cool, prepare bulletproof coffee by blending hot coffee, remaining butter, and MCT oil
Blend coffee mixture on high speed 30-60 seconds until frothy and creamy
Gently run knife around muffin edges to loosen, then remove from tin
Serve warm egg muffins immediately alongside hot bulletproof coffee
Muffins will be fluffy and slightly deflated (normal as they cool), coffee should be rich and creamy

ingredients.notes: About 3.5 oz, uniform thickness for even cooking
About 2 strips, good quality for best flavor
About 1.5 eggs, room temperature for even cooking
Should yield slightly to pressure, diced just before serving
Crisp hearts preferred, chopped into bite-size pieces

instructions: Fill medium saucepan with enough water to cover eggs by 1 inch and bring to rolling boil
Carefully lower room temperature eggs into boiling water using spoon
Cook eggs exactly 11 minutes for perfectly set but tender yolks
Meanwhile, prepare large bowl of ice water for shocking eggs
Remove eggs with slotted spoon and immediately transfer to ice bath for 2 minutes
While eggs cool, pat chicken breast dry and season both sides generously with salt and pepper
Heat large skillet over medium-high heat until hot
Add chicken breast and cook 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown and internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C)
Remove chicken to cutting board and let rest 5 minutes before dicing into bite-sized pieces
In same pan (without washing), cook bacon strips over medium heat until crispy, about 4-5 minutes per side
Transfer bacon to paper towels to drain excess fat, then chop into small pieces
Peel cooled eggs under cool running water, then dice into quarters
Dice avocado and immediately toss with lemon juice to prevent browning
Wash and thoroughly dry romaine lettuce, then chop into bite-sized pieces
Arrange chopped romaine in large serving bowl or platter as base
In classic Cobb style, arrange chicken, bacon, diced eggs, avocado, cherry tomatoes, and blue cheese in distinct rows over lettuce
Drizzle olive oil evenly over entire salad and season with salt and pepper
Serve immediately with components visible in attractive rows, allowing diners to mix as desired
Alternatively, gently toss all components together just before serving for family-style presentation

ingredients.notes: 5-6 oz, pounded to ¼ inch thickness for even cooking
Divided: 15g for base coating, 11g for final breading
Shredded or sliced thin for melting

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C) for final cheese melting
Place chicken breast between plastic wrap or parchment and pound to uniform ¼ inch thickness
Pat chicken completely dry with paper towels, then season both sides with salt and pepper
Set up three-station dredging: 15g almond flour in first dish, beaten egg in second, remaining almond flour mixed with Parmesan, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder in third
Lightly coat chicken in first almond flour dish, shaking off excess
Dip floured chicken in beaten egg, allowing excess to drip off
Press chicken firmly into final almond flour-Parmesan mixture, coating both sides completely
Use fingers to gently press coating into chicken to ensure adhesion
Let breaded chicken rest 5 minutes to set coating before cooking
Heat olive oil in large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering
Carefully place breaded chicken in hot oil and cook 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown
Check internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C) with instant-read thermometer
Remove from heat and spoon marinara sauce evenly over chicken
Top with mozzarella cheese and any remaining Parmesan
Transfer skillet to preheated oven for 5-8 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly
Remove from oven and let rest 3 minutes before serving
Coating should be golden and crispy, cheese melted and lightly golden on top
Serve immediately while coating is still crispy and cheese is hot and stretchy

ingredients.notes: Thinly sliced, premium quality for best flavor
Firm but ripe, sliced into thin strips

instructions: Remove cream cheese from refrigerator 30 minutes before assembly to reach room temperature
Lay large sheet of plastic wrap (about 20 inches long) on clean work surface
Arrange smoked salmon slices on plastic wrap, overlapping slightly to create rectangle about 8×6 inches
In small bowl, mix softened cream cheese until smooth and easily spreadable
Using spoon or offset spatula, spread cream cheese mixture evenly across salmon rectangle
Slice avocado into thin strips (¼ to ½ inch thick) and immediately sprinkle with lemon juice
Arrange avocado strips lengthwise along one edge of cream cheese-covered salmon
Using plastic wrap as guide, carefully lift edge closest to avocado and begin rolling tightly
Continue rolling, using plastic wrap to maintain tight cylinder shape, but don't roll plastic into salmon
Wrap completed roll tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate 15-30 minutes to firm up for clean slicing
Remove from refrigerator and use sharp knife to slice into ½-inch thick rounds
Clean knife between cuts to maintain neat appearance
Arrange sliced rolls on serving plate in single layer
Drizzle lightly with extra virgin olive oil using spoon or small squeeze bottle
Garnish each piece with small pinch of fresh dill and 2-3 capers
Finish with freshly cracked black pepper and serve immediately
Rolls should be neat cylinders with visible spirals of salmon, cream cheese, and avocado

ingredients.notes: 5-6 oz piece, 1 inch thick for even cooking
Cut into uniform florets for even cooking
35% fat content for rich, creamy mash
High smoke point for proper searing
1 clove, roasted with cauliflower for depth
½ teaspoon leaves for pork seasoning

instructions: Remove pork from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) for finishing if using thick cuts
Pat pork completely dry with paper towels (essential for proper searing)
Season generously on all sides with salt, pepper, and fresh thyme leaves
Bring large pot of salted water to boil for cauliflower
Add cauliflower florets and whole garlic clove to boiling water
Cook cauliflower 12-15 minutes until very tender and easily pierced with fork
Meanwhile, heat oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat until very hot
Add avocado oil to hot pan and swirl to coat
Carefully place seasoned pork in hot oil and sear 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown
If pork is thick (over 1 inch), transfer skillet to oven for 5-8 minutes to finish
Cook until internal temperature reaches 135°F (57°C) for medium doneness
Remove pork to cutting board, tent with foil, and rest 10 minutes (temperature will rise to 145°F)
Drain cauliflower and garlic thoroughly, letting excess water evaporate 2-3 minutes
Add drained cauliflower, roasted garlic, butter, and cream cheese to large bowl
Mash with potato masher or blend with immersion blender until smooth and creamy
Gradually add heavy cream until desired consistency is reached
Season cauliflower mash with salt and pepper to taste
Add 8g butter to skillet drippings and swirl to create simple pan sauce
Slice rested pork against the grain into ½-inch thick medallions
Serve sliced pork over warm cauliflower mash, drizzled with pan sauce
Pork should be slightly pink in center and very juicy, mash should be smooth and creamy

ingredients.notes: 6-7 oz, 1-1¼ inch thick, high quality cut

instructions: Remove steak from refrigerator 30 minutes before grilling to bring to room temperature
Preheat grill to high heat (500°F / 260°C) for proper searing
Clean and oil grill grates to prevent sticking
Pat steak completely dry with paper towels to ensure good sear
Rub steak all over with avocado oil, coating both sides evenly
Season generously with kosher salt, black pepper, and garlic powder on both sides
Let seasoned steak rest 10 minutes while preparing avocado salsa
Dice avocado into small cubes and immediately toss with half the lime juice
Remove seeds from tomato and dice into small, uniform pieces
Finely dice red onion and mince jalapeño (remove seeds for less heat)
In mixing bowl, gently combine avocado, tomato, red onion, jalapeño, cilantro, and remaining lime juice
Season salsa with salt and pepper to taste, then set aside
Place steak on hottest part of grill and cook 4-5 minutes without moving
Flip steak and grill another 4-5 minutes for medium-rare (135°F / 57°C internal temperature)
For perfect grill marks, rotate steak 45 degrees halfway through each side
Check internal temperature with thermometer - remove 5°F before desired doneness
Transfer steak to cutting board and tent loosely with foil
Let steak rest 5-10 minutes to redistribute juices (temperature will rise during rest)
Slice steak against the grain into ½-inch thick pieces
Arrange sliced steak on serving plate and top generously with fresh avocado salsa
Serve immediately while steak is still warm and salsa is fresh and vibrant

ingredients.notes: About 3 strips, high-quality for best flavor and texture
Firm but ripe, for slicing and mashing
About 2 eggs, room temperature for even cooking
Prevents avocado browning and adds brightness

equipment_needed: Large cast iron or heavy skillet
instructions: Remove eggs from refrigerator 15 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Heat large cast iron skillet over medium heat (cold start prevents bacon from sticking)
Arrange bacon strips in single layer without overlapping, cook 4-5 minutes per side
Turn bacon with tongs to ensure even browning and render fat completely
Transfer crispy bacon to paper towels to drain, reserving 2 tablespoons fat in pan
Cut avocado in half, remove pit, and create larger cavity by scooping out additional flesh
Mash scooped avocado flesh with lemon juice and pinch of salt until smooth but chunky
Slice remaining avocado half into thin, even slices and drizzle with lemon juice
Heat bacon fat in skillet over medium-low heat for gentle egg cooking
Crack room temperature eggs into pan, cooking slowly to set whites while keeping yolks runny (3-4 minutes)
Cover pan briefly if needed to set whites without overcooking yolks
Season eggs with salt and pepper while cooking
Chop cooled bacon into bite-sized pieces for easy eating
Spread mashed avocado in bottom of serving bowl as creamy base
Arrange sliced avocado around edges of bowl in overlapping pattern
Carefully transfer fried eggs to center of bowl, keeping yolks intact
Sprinkle chopped bacon around and over eggs for textural contrast
Drizzle everything with extra virgin olive oil in decorative pattern
Finish with flaky sea salt, cracked black pepper, and red pepper flakes if using
Serve immediately while eggs are warm and bacon is still crispy

ingredients.notes: 21-25 count, peeled and deveined, fresh or thawed
Firm but ripe, for clean slicing
1 tablespoon, for brightness and preventing avocado browning
Thinly sliced for crunch and color

instructions: Pat shrimp completely dry with paper towels to ensure proper searing
Season shrimp with salt, pepper, and paprika, tossing to coat evenly
Heat large skillet over medium-high heat until very hot
Add half the olive oil to hot pan and swirl to coat
Add seasoned shrimp in single layer without overcrowding
Cook shrimp undisturbed for 2 minutes until pink and golden on bottom
Flip shrimp with tongs and cook another 1-2 minutes until opaque throughout
Add minced garlic in final 30 seconds, stirring to prevent burning
Remove from heat immediately to prevent overcooking - shrimp should be just cooked through
Transfer shrimp to plate and let cool to room temperature while preparing salad
Wash and thoroughly dry baby spinach using salad spinner or paper towels
Cut avocado into uniform cubes and immediately toss with half the lime juice
Thinly slice red onion into half-moons and soak in cold water 5 minutes to reduce bite
In small bowl, whisk remaining olive oil with remaining lime juice for simple vinaigrette
Season vinaigrette with salt and pepper to taste
Arrange baby spinach in large serving bowl as base
Top spinach with cubed avocado and drained red onion slices
Add cooled shrimp over the top, distributing evenly
Drizzle vinaigrette over entire salad just before serving
Garnish with fresh cilantro and additional cracked pepper
Serve immediately while shrimp is still slightly warm and avocado is fresh

ingredients.notes: Cut into bite-sized pieces, dark meat preferred for tenderness
Riced in food processor or pre-riced

instructions: Pat chicken pieces dry and season with salt, pepper, half the garam masala, and turmeric
Let seasoned chicken marinate 10 minutes while preparing other ingredients
Heat coconut oil in large skillet over medium-high heat
Add seasoned chicken pieces and cook 6-8 minutes, browning on all sides
Remove chicken to plate and set aside (it will finish cooking in sauce)
In same pan, add diced onion and cook 3-4 minutes until softened and lightly golden
Add minced ginger and garlic, cooking 1 minute until fragrant
Add remaining garam masala, paprika, and coriander, stirring for 30 seconds to bloom spices
Stir in tomato paste and cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly to develop deep color
Gradually add heavy cream while stirring to prevent curdling
Add ghee or butter and stir until melted and incorporated
Return chicken to pan and simmer 8-10 minutes until chicken is cooked through and sauce thickens
Meanwhile, rice cauliflower in food processor if not pre-riced
Heat medium skillet over medium heat and sauté riced cauliflower 4-5 minutes until tender
Season cauliflower rice with salt and pepper to taste
Taste butter chicken sauce and adjust seasoning with salt and additional garam masala if needed
Serve butter chicken over cauliflower rice immediately
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve while sauce is hot and creamy

ingredients.notes: Smooth, no added sugar or oils
Solid at room temperature, unrefined preferred
About 3 eggs, room temperature for best texture
Pure vanilla, ½ teaspoon for fat bombs

equipment_needed: Mini muffin tin or silicone molds
instructions: Line mini muffin tin with paper liners or use silicone fat bomb molds
In microwave-safe bowl, heat coconut oil in 10-second increments until just melted (not hot)
Add almond butter to melted coconut oil and whisk until completely smooth
Stir in vanilla extract, pinch of sea salt, and sweetener if using
Taste mixture and adjust sweetness or salt as desired
Divide mixture evenly among molds, filling each about ¾ full
Place filled molds on baking sheet and freeze for 20-25 minutes until completely firm
Meanwhile, remove eggs from refrigerator to bring to room temperature
Heat non-stick pan over low-medium heat (lower than typical for creamy eggs)
Add butter to pan and let melt completely
Crack room temperature eggs into bowl and whisk until whites and yolks are fully combined
Pour eggs into buttered pan and immediately begin stirring with rubber spatula
Cook slowly, stirring constantly, removing from heat briefly if eggs cook too quickly
Continue stirring and cooking for 4-5 minutes until eggs are creamy but just set
Season scrambled eggs with salt to taste while still warm
Remove fat bombs from freezer when firm to touch
Serve warm scrambled eggs immediately with 2-3 chilled fat bombs on the side
Fat bombs should be firm but not rock-hard, eggs should be creamy and just set

ingredients.notes: 2 medium zucchini, uniform thickness for even slicing
Shredded, not pre-shredded for better melting
For cooking beef and coating dish

instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) and lightly grease 8x8 inch baking dish with olive oil
Trim ends from zucchini and slice lengthwise into ⅛-inch thick strips using mandoline or sharp knife
Lay zucchini slices on paper towels and sprinkle both sides generously with kosher salt
Let salted zucchini sit for 15-20 minutes to draw out moisture
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat
Add ground beef and cook 5-6 minutes, breaking up with spatula until browned
Add minced garlic and Italian seasoning, cooking 1 minute until fragrant
Season beef with salt and pepper, then remove from heat and set aside
Remove cream cheese from refrigerator to soften while zucchini drains
After 20 minutes, blot zucchini slices thoroughly with clean paper towels to remove all moisture
Spread thin layer of softened cream cheese in bottom of prepared baking dish
Layer half the zucchini slices in single layer, slightly overlapping
Spread half the cooked ground beef mixture over zucchini layer
Add remaining zucchini slices in second layer
Top with remaining beef mixture and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese
Cover with aluminum foil and bake 25 minutes
Remove foil and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese
Bake uncovered additional 10-15 minutes until cheese is golden and bubbling
Let lasagna rest 10 minutes before slicing to allow layers to set and prevent sogginess
Cut into squares and serve while cheese is still hot and stretchy

ingredients.notes: 6 oz, 1-1.5 inch thick for even cooking
Firm, bright green, outer leaves removed
About 2 strips, chopped into small pieces
High smoke point for searing pork

equipment_needed: Large cast iron or oven-safe skillet
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) for finishing pork
Remove pork from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Trim outer leaves from Brussels sprouts and cut in half lengthwise
Chop bacon into small, uniform pieces for even rendering
Pat pork completely dry with paper towels for proper searing
Mix brown sugar with salt and pepper, then rub all over pork chop
Heat cast iron skillet over medium-high heat until very hot
Add avocado oil and swirl to coat pan
Sear pork chop 3-4 minutes per side until deep golden brown crust forms
Transfer skillet to preheated oven and cook 12-15 minutes until internal temperature reaches 140°F (60°C)
Remove pork to cutting board, tent with foil, and rest 5 minutes (temperature will rise to 145°F)
Meanwhile, add chopped bacon to same skillet over medium heat
Cook bacon 3-4 minutes until crispy and fat is rendered
Add halved Brussels sprouts cut-side down to hot bacon fat
Sear undisturbed 3-4 minutes until deeply caramelized and golden brown
Add minced garlic and thyme, tossing sprouts to coat
Continue cooking 2-3 minutes until sprouts are tender-crisp
Add butter to skillet and toss until melted and coating sprouts
Season Brussels sprouts with salt and pepper to taste
Slice rested pork against the grain into ½-inch thick medallions
Serve sliced pork over caramelized Brussels sprouts while both are hot
Pork should be slightly pink in center, sprouts should be golden and crisp-tender

ingredients.notes: About 3 eggs, room temperature for even cooking
High quality Greek or Italian preferred

equipment_needed: Cast iron or oven-safe skillet (8-10 inch)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) for optimal egg cooking temperature
Heat oven-safe skillet over medium heat and add olive oil
Add diced onion and cook 3-4 minutes until softened and translucent
Add minced garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant, stirring to prevent browning
Add fresh spinach in batches, allowing each addition to wilt before adding more
Season wilted spinach with oregano, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes if using
Cook spinach mixture 2-3 minutes more until excess moisture has evaporated
Distribute spinach mixture evenly across bottom of skillet
Using back of spoon, create 3 shallow wells in spinach mixture
Carefully crack eggs into each well, trying to keep yolks intact
Sprinkle crumbled feta cheese generously around and between eggs
Season eggs lightly with salt and pepper
Transfer skillet to preheated oven and bake 8-12 minutes
Check at 8 minutes - whites should be set but yolks still slightly runny
Continue baking 2-4 minutes more if firmer yolks desired
Remove from oven when egg whites are completely opaque but yolks jiggle slightly
Let rest 2-3 minutes before serving (eggs will continue cooking from residual heat)
Serve directly from skillet while hot, with extra feta crumbled on top if desired

ingredients.notes: Dark meat preferred for flavor, cut into small dice

instructions: Remove chicken from refrigerator 15 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Dice chicken thighs into small, uniform pieces (about ¼ inch) for even cooking
Pat chicken completely dry with paper towels and season with salt and pepper
Wash butter lettuce leaves gently and spin dry thoroughly in salad spinner
Select best cup-shaped leaves and arrange on paper towels to continue drying
In small bowl, whisk together hoisin sauce, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sesame oil
Heat large skillet or wok over medium-high heat until very hot
Add coconut oil and swirl to coat pan
Add diced chicken and cook 5-6 minutes, stirring frequently until golden and cooked through
Add minced garlic and ginger, cooking 30 seconds until fragrant
Pour sauce mixture over chicken and toss to coat evenly
Cook 1-2 minutes more until sauce is slightly reduced and glossy
Remove from heat and add roughly chopped walnuts, tossing gently
Let chicken mixture cool slightly while preparing serving station
Arrange dried lettuce cups on serving platter like small bowls
Fill each lettuce cup with warm chicken-walnut mixture just before serving
Top each wrap with small dollop of sour cream
Garnish with sliced green onions and serve immediately
Provide extra lettuce cups as wraps can be fragile when overfilled

ingredients.notes: 16-20 count, peeled and deveined, pat dry
About 2 zucchini, spiralized with thick noodle blade
35% fat content for proper sauce consistency

instructions: Spiralize zucchini using thickest noodle blade, trimming long strands with scissors
Place spiralized zucchini in colander, sprinkle with salt, and toss to coat evenly
Let salted zucchini drain 30 minutes to remove excess moisture
Meanwhile, pat shrimp completely dry with paper towels and season with salt and pepper
After draining, press zucchini noodles gently with hands to remove more water, then pat dry
Heat large skillet over medium-high heat until very hot
Add half the butter and let melt and foam
Add shrimp in single layer and cook 1-2 minutes per side until pink and golden
Remove shrimp to plate and set aside (don't overcook as they'll finish in sauce)
In same skillet, add minced garlic and red pepper flakes, cooking 30 seconds until fragrant
Add white wine (if using) to deglaze pan, scraping up any browned bits
Add heavy cream and bring to gentle simmer
Gradually whisk in grated Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth
Add remaining butter and swirl to incorporate into sauce
Return cooked shrimp to pan and toss to coat in sauce
Add prepared zucchini noodles and toss gently for 30-60 seconds just to warm through
Remove from heat immediately to prevent zucchini from becoming watery
Add fresh lemon juice and toss once more
Season with additional salt and pepper to taste
Serve immediately garnished with fresh parsley and extra Parmesan
Zucchini noodles should be tender-crisp, not mushy, and sauce should coat everything lightly

ingredients.notes: About 2.5 eggs, room temperature for smooth texture
High quality, not too thick for easy rolling

instructions: Remove eggs from refrigerator 15 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
In mixing bowl, whisk eggs with heavy cream until completely smooth and no streaks remain
Season egg mixture lightly with salt and pepper, then let rest 5 minutes
Slice avocado into thin lengthwise strips and set aside
Heat 8-10 inch non-stick skillet over low-medium heat
Add small amount of butter (about 1/3 of total) and swirl to coat pan completely
Pour half the egg mixture into center of pan and immediately swirl to coat bottom evenly
Cook over low heat for 1-2 minutes until bottom is just set but top still slightly wet
Using thin spatula, carefully check that edges are loose and omelette moves freely in pan
Slide omelette onto large plate, flipping pan upside down if needed
Repeat process with remaining egg mixture to make second wrap
Let both egg wraps cool for 2-3 minutes until easy to handle
On first wrap, layer half the ham slices in center, leaving 1-inch border
Add half the cheese over ham, then arrange half the avocado slices on top
Starting from one edge, carefully roll the wrap tightly but gently to avoid tearing
Repeat filling and rolling process with second egg wrap
Using sharp knife, slice each roll diagonally into 2-3 pieces to show filling layers
Serve immediately while egg is still warm and cheese is slightly melted
Wraps should be thin and flexible with visible cross-section of colorful fillings

ingredients.notes: Full-fat for best texture and flavor
For serving base, sliced just before serving
1 small stalk, finely diced for crunch

instructions: Place eggs in medium saucepan and cover with cold water by 1 inch
Bring water to rolling boil over high heat, then immediately reduce to medium-low
Simmer eggs for exactly 12 minutes for perfect hard-boiled texture
While eggs cook, prepare large bowl of ice water for shocking
Meanwhile, cook bacon in large skillet over medium heat until crispy, about 6-8 minutes
Transfer bacon to paper towels to drain, then crumble into small pieces when cool
When timer goes off, immediately transfer eggs to ice water bath using slotted spoon
Let eggs cool in ice bath for at least 15 minutes to stop cooking process completely
Peel cooled eggs under cool running water, starting from larger end for easier removal
Pat peeled eggs dry and roughly chop into chunky pieces (not too fine)
In large mixing bowl, separate egg yolks from whites if desired for smoother texture
Mash yolks with fork until smooth, then add mayonnaise and Dijon mustard
Mix yolk mixture until completely smooth and creamy
Add chopped egg whites, crumbled bacon, diced celery, and chives
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice, then fold gently to combine
Season with salt and white pepper to taste
Chill egg salad in refrigerator for at least 1 hour to allow flavors to meld
Just before serving, slice avocado into thick rounds and arrange on plates
Serve chilled egg salad over avocado slices while textures remain distinct
Egg salad should be creamy but chunky, with crispy bacon providing textural contrast

ingredients.notes: Good fat content for juicy meatballs
½ egg, room temperature for binding
Freshly grated, acts as binder and flavor

instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) for finishing meatballs
In large mixing bowl, combine ground beef, half the beaten egg, almond flour, and grated Parmesan
Add grated onion, minced garlic, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper to meat mixture
Add 1 tablespoon heavy cream to meat mixture for moisture and tenderness
Using hands, gently mix ingredients until just combined - avoid overmixing which makes tough meatballs
Form mixture into 8-10 uniform meatballs using small cookie scoop or hands
Heat large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat and add half the butter
Brown meatballs on all sides, about 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown crust forms
Transfer skillet to preheated oven and bake 10-12 minutes until internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C)
Meanwhile, slice zucchini into ¼-inch rounds
For cheese sauce, heat small saucepan over low heat and add remaining butter
Once butter melts, gradually whisk in remaining heavy cream
Bring cream to gentle simmer, then gradually add grated cheddar while whisking constantly
Continue whisking until cheese is completely melted and sauce is smooth
Season cheese sauce with salt and pepper to taste, keep warm over lowest heat
In same skillet used for meatballs (after removing them), sauté zucchini rounds 2-3 minutes per side
Cook zucchini until golden and tender-crisp, seasoning with salt and pepper
Arrange sautéed zucchini on serving plates
Place hot meatballs over zucchini and drizzle generously with warm cheese sauce
Serve immediately while meatballs are hot and cheese sauce is creamy and smooth

ingredients.notes: About 3 strips, high quality for best texture
About 2 eggs, cold from refrigerator for consistent timing
Sliced just before serving to prevent browning

instructions: Fill medium saucepan with water and bring to rolling boil over high heat
Prepare large bowl of ice water for shocking eggs
Using slotted spoon, gently lower cold eggs into boiling water
Set timer for exactly 6½ minutes for perfect jammy yolks
Meanwhile, heat large skillet over medium heat for bacon
Add bacon strips and cook 4-5 minutes per side until golden and crispy
Transfer bacon to paper towels to drain excess fat
When timer sounds, immediately transfer eggs to ice bath using slotted spoon
Let eggs chill in ice bath for 3-4 minutes to stop cooking completely
While eggs cool, slice avocado into neat fan slices and sprinkle with lemon juice
Roughly chop macadamia nuts into bite-sized pieces
Carefully peel soft-boiled eggs under cool running water, starting from larger end
Pat peeled eggs dry and cut in half to reveal jammy golden yolks
On large serving plate, arrange avocado slices in fan pattern
Place halved soft-boiled eggs cut-side up to showcase runny yolks
Break bacon into rustic pieces and scatter around plate
Sprinkle chopped macadamia nuts over entire platter for crunch
Drizzle extra virgin olive oil over avocado and around plate edges
Finish with flaky sea salt and freshly cracked black pepper
Serve immediately while eggs are still warm and bacon is crispy

ingredients.notes: 5 oz, 1-1.5 inches thick, room temperature before cooking

instructions: Remove steak from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Pat steak completely dry with paper towels - this is critical for proper searing
Season generously with kosher salt and black pepper on both sides
Clean mushrooms with damp paper towel and slice into thick pieces
Heat cast iron skillet over high heat for 5-7 minutes until smoking hot
Add avocado oil and swirl to coat - oil should shimmer immediately
Carefully place steak in smoking pan and don't move for 2-3 minutes
Flip steak and sear other side 2-3 minutes for medium-rare
Add butter, crushed garlic, and thyme sprigs to pan
Tilt pan and continuously baste steak with foaming butter using large spoon
Cook while basting until internal temperature reaches 130°F (54°C) for medium-rare
Remove steak to cutting board and tent with foil to rest 10 minutes
In same hot pan, add sliced mushrooms and sauté 5-7 minutes until golden brown
Season mushrooms with salt and pepper while cooking
Cook until mushrooms are caramelized and most moisture has evaporated
Slice rested steak against the grain into ½-inch thick slices
Arrange sliced steak on serving plate and top with sautéed garlic mushrooms
Drizzle any remaining pan juices over steak and mushrooms
Serve immediately while steak is still warm and mushrooms are aromatic

ingredients.notes: 6 oz, cut horizontally and pounded to even thickness
Thick spears preferred, woody ends trimmed

instructions: Cut chicken breast in half horizontally to create two thinner pieces
Using meat mallet, pound chicken to even ¼-inch thickness for uniform cooking
Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper on both sides
Preheat grill to 425°F (220°C) for optimal cooking temperature
In food processor, pulse garlic until minced
Add pine nuts and pulse until roughly chopped
Add fresh basil leaves and pulse until chopped
With processor running, slowly drizzle in half the olive oil until smooth paste forms
Add grated Parmesan and lemon juice, pulse to combine
Season pesto with salt and pepper to taste
Reserve half the pesto for serving, use other half for coating chicken
Brush chicken pieces generously with pesto on both sides
Let marinated chicken rest 10 minutes to absorb flavors
Meanwhile, trim woody ends from asparagus and toss with remaining olive oil
Season asparagus with salt and pepper
Grill chicken 5-6 minutes per side until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C)
Grill asparagus alongside chicken for 4-5 minutes, turning occasionally
Cook asparagus until tender-crisp and lightly charred
Remove chicken and let rest 3 minutes before slicing
Slice grilled chicken against the grain
Arrange chicken and asparagus on serving plate
Dollop reserved fresh pesto over chicken just before serving
Serve immediately while chicken is hot and pesto is vibrant green

ingredients.notes: About 3 eggs, room temperature for even cooking
About 3 cups fresh, thoroughly washed and dried
35% fat content for richness and texture

equipment_needed: 10-inch cast iron skillet or oven-safe baking dish
instructions: Remove eggs from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature for even cooking
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) with rack positioned in center
Thoroughly wash fresh spinach and pat completely dry with paper towels to remove all moisture
Heat large skillet over medium heat and add half the butter
Add minced garlic to hot butter and sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant but not browned
Add fresh spinach to skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently until completely wilted and reduced in volume
Continue cooking spinach for additional 1-2 minutes to evaporate any remaining moisture
Season wilted spinach lightly with salt and pepper, then remove from heat
Grease 10-inch cast iron skillet or oven-safe baking dish thoroughly with remaining butter
In medium mixing bowl, whisk together room temperature eggs and heavy cream until completely smooth
Season egg mixture generously with salt and freshly cracked black pepper
Spread wilted spinach evenly across bottom of greased skillet, ensuring no wet spots remain
Pour seasoned egg mixture slowly over spinach, allowing it to flow into all areas
Crumble feta cheese evenly over surface, leaving some larger chunks for texture contrast
Place skillet on stovetop over medium heat and cook for 2 minutes until edges just begin to set
Immediately transfer skillet to preheated oven and bake for 15-18 minutes
Check for doneness by making small slit in center - no raw egg should run out
Frittata is complete when center is set, top is lightly golden and slightly puffed
Remove from oven and let rest 5 minutes to finish setting and cool slightly
Cut into wedges directly in skillet and serve warm with golden, creamy texture throughout

ingredients.notes: About 5 oz, preferably grass-fed for best flavor
Firm but ripe, for clean dicing
Inner leaves preferred, thoroughly washed and dried
1 teaspoon, quality brand for best flavor
¾ teaspoon, freshly ground if possible
¼ teaspoon, Mexican oregano if available
Juice from ½ lime, for brightness

instructions: In small bowl, combine chili powder, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, and oregano to create homemade taco seasoning
Heat large wide skillet over medium-high heat until hot (no oil needed for 80/20 beef)
Add ground beef to hot skillet, breaking it apart with wooden spoon into small, even pieces
Cook beef undisturbed for 2-3 minutes to allow proper browning and develop flavor
Stir and break up meat further, continuing to cook until no pink remains, about 5-7 minutes total
Drain excess fat from skillet, leaving about 1 tablespoon for flavor
Reduce heat to medium and sprinkle taco seasoning evenly over browned beef
Stir to coat meat thoroughly and cook for 1-2 minutes until spices become fragrant
Add 2 tablespoons water to create slight sauce, cooking until just absorbed
Season with salt to taste and remove from heat
Meanwhile, wash and thoroughly dry romaine lettuce, then chop into bite-sized pieces
Dice avocado into uniform cubes and immediately toss with half the lime juice to prevent browning
Grate cheddar cheese fresh using box grater for best melting quality
Allow sour cream to come to room temperature for easy drizzling
Arrange chopped romaine in large serving bowl as base
Spoon warm seasoned beef over lettuce while still hot to slightly wilt greens
Top with diced avocado, grated cheddar cheese, and dollops of sour cream
Drizzle remaining lime juice over entire bowl for brightness and acidity
Serve immediately while beef is still warm and cheese can melt slightly
Mix components together just before eating for best flavor distribution and texture contrast

ingredients.notes: 1 can, drained and flaked, skin and bones removed
For keto-friendly binding, not chunky meal
About 1 egg, beaten, for binding and richness
For pan-frying, high smoke point cooking
Trimmed ends, uniform size for even cooking
From ½ lemon, for brightness and flavor
½ teaspoon, for binding and tang

instructions: Drain canned salmon thoroughly in fine mesh strainer, pressing gently to remove excess liquid
Transfer drained salmon to large mixing bowl and carefully flake with fork, removing any skin or bones
Allow salmon to air-dry for 5 minutes to remove remaining moisture for better binding
In same bowl, combine flaked salmon with beaten egg, Dijon mustard, and lemon juice
Add almond flour gradually while mixing gently to avoid breaking up salmon chunks
Fold in chopped fresh dill, garlic powder, salt, and pepper until just combined
Mix should hold together when pressed but not be overly dense or compact
If mixture seems too wet, add additional almond flour 1 teaspoon at a time
Using clean hands, gently form mixture into 3 equal patties about ½ inch thick
Place formed patties on plate and refrigerate 15 minutes to firm up and prevent breaking
Meanwhile, prepare green beans by trimming ends and cutting into uniform 1-inch pieces
Set up steamer basket in medium saucepan with 1 inch of water, bring to simmer
Steam green beans covered for 5-7 minutes until bright green and crisp-tender
Remove from heat and keep warm while cooking salmon patties
Heat large skillet over medium heat and add butter, swirling to coat bottom
When butter is melted and lightly foaming, carefully place chilled patties in pan
Cook undisturbed for 3-4 minutes until golden brown crust forms on bottom
Using thin spatula, gently flip patties and cook another 3-4 minutes until second side is golden
Internal temperature should reach 145°F (63°C) for food safety
Transfer cooked patties to serving plates and let rest 2 minutes
Season steamed green beans with salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lemon
Serve salmon patties immediately with warm green beans and dollop of room temperature sour cream
Garnish with extra fresh dill and lemon wedges for bright, restaurant-quality presentation

ingredients.notes: Room temperature for smooth blending and fluffy texture
About 2 eggs, room temperature for better incorporation
Smooth variety, no added sugar or oils
For cooking pancakes, plus extra for serving
About 2 strips, high-quality for crispy texture
Blanched almonds ground fine, not almond meal

instructions: Remove cream cheese and eggs from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking for optimal blending
Start bacon cooking in large skillet over medium heat, turning frequently until crispy, about 8-10 minutes
Transfer cooked bacon to paper towels to drain, reserve 1 tablespoon fat in pan
In blender, combine room temperature cream cheese and eggs, blend on high for 30 seconds until completely smooth
Add almond butter, almond flour, baking powder, vanilla extract, and pinch of salt to blender
Blend again for 15-20 seconds until batter is completely smooth and no lumps remain
Let batter rest for 5 minutes to allow almond flour to absorb moisture and achieve proper consistency
Heat non-stick skillet over medium-low heat and add small amount of butter
Pour batter using ¼ cup measure to create small 4-inch diameter pancakes for easier flipping
Cook pancakes for 2-3 minutes until edges are set and center begins to bubble slightly
Using wide spatula, carefully flip pancakes (they are more delicate than regular pancakes)
Cook second side for 1-2 minutes until golden brown and cooked through
Transfer pancakes to serving plate and keep warm while cooking remaining batter
Repeat process with remaining batter, adding more butter to pan as needed
Serve immediately with crispy bacon strips and extra butter pats
Pancakes should be light, fluffy, and have a slightly nutty flavor from almond components
Optional: Drizzle with sugar-free syrup or serve with fresh berries for additional flavor

ingredients.notes: Divided: for kale massage and salmon cooking
Juice from ½ lemon, for kale massage and finishing
Maldon or similar, for kale massage and finishing

instructions: Remove salmon from refrigerator 15-20 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Preheat grill to high heat, around 450°F (230°C) for proper searing
Pat salmon fillet completely dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture for crispy skin
Check salmon skin for any remaining scales and remove if present
Brush skin side of salmon lightly with olive oil and season both sides with salt and pepper
Meanwhile, remove kale leaves from tough stems by sliding fingers along stem to strip leaves
Tear kale leaves into bite-sized pieces and wash thoroughly, then dry completely
In large mixing bowl, combine torn kale with half the lemon juice and pinch of salt
Using clean hands, massage kale vigorously for 2-3 minutes until leaves soften and darken
Continue massaging until kale reduces in volume by about one-third and becomes tender
Add half the olive oil to massaged kale and toss gently to coat evenly
Let massaged kale rest while cooking salmon to further tenderize
Place salmon skin-side down on hot grill grates, cooking 90% on skin side for 4-5 minutes
Do not move salmon during initial cooking to achieve crispy skin and prevent sticking
Check for doneness with instant-read thermometer: 120°F (49°C) for medium-rare
Flip salmon carefully using tongs and cook flesh side for 1-2 minutes to finish
Remove salmon from grill and let rest 2 minutes for juices to redistribute
While salmon rests, roughly chop macadamia nuts for textural contrast
Arrange massaged kale in serving bowl as base
Carefully place grilled salmon on top of kale, skin-side up to showcase crispy texture
Scatter chopped macadamia nuts around and over salmon for crunch
Drizzle remaining olive oil over entire bowl in decorative pattern
Finish with remaining lemon juice, additional flaky sea salt, and fresh cracked pepper
Serve immediately while salmon is warm and skin is still crispy

meals.meal_name: Roast Chicken Thighs with Buttered Veg

ingredients.notes: Skin-on, about 6 oz, organic free-range preferred
Cut into uniform florets for even steaming
Cut into uniform florets, similar size to broccoli
¼ teaspoon, for color and smoky flavor
For chicken seasoning and vegetable finishing
Coarsely ground for chicken and vegetables
Juice from ¼ lemon, for vegetable brightness

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C) with rack positioned in center for optimal heat circulation
Place wire cooling rack on top of rimmed baking sheet for elevated chicken cooking
Remove chicken thighs from refrigerator 20 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature
Pat chicken thighs completely dry with paper towels on all surfaces to remove excess moisture
In small bowl, combine garlic powder, dried thyme, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper
Drizzle olive oil over chicken thighs and rub into skin and underneath for even coating
Season chicken generously with spice mixture, working seasoning under skin where possible
Place seasoned thighs skin-side up on wire rack, ensuring pieces don't touch for proper air circulation
Roast in preheated oven for 35-40 minutes until internal temperature reaches 175°F (79°C) for optimal tenderness
For extra crispy skin, broil for final 2-3 minutes watching carefully to prevent burning
Meanwhile, prepare steamer setup with 1 inch water in medium saucepan and steamer basket
Cut broccoli and cauliflower into uniform 1-inch florets for even cooking
When chicken has 10 minutes left, bring steamer water to gentle simmer
Add cauliflower florets to steamer first (they take longer), cover and steam 3 minutes
Add broccoli florets to same steamer, cover and continue steaming 4-5 minutes until crisp-tender
Vegetables should be bright in color and easily pierced with fork but retain slight firmness
Remove chicken from oven and let rest 5 minutes for juices to redistribute
Transfer steamed vegetables to large mixing bowl and immediately toss with butter pieces
Season buttered vegetables with salt, pepper, and fresh lemon juice while still warm
Arrange vegetables on serving platter and top with perfectly roasted chicken thighs
Serve immediately while chicken skin is crispy and vegetables are warm and buttery
Chicken should have golden-brown, crispy skin with juicy, tender meat that easily pulls from bone
